title: Rethinking knowledge management structure
content: Realized today I over-categorize in Notion, which raises review cost. Need an evolution-centric organization, not a strict tree hierarchy.

title: Pain points of fragmented notes
content: Many scattered sparks live across random pages and temporary blocks; reconstructing chains is hard—feels like knowledge is evaporating.

title: Experiment: timeline aggregation of ideas
content: Tried a 'timeline + theme' view; pin related thoughts along a temporal axis—seems to reveal evolution patterns.

title: Semantic time-travel concept draft
content: If AI can grasp the fuzzy early shape of an idea through to its later crystallization, it could answer with an evolution narrative. Call this semantic time travel.

title: Assess lightweight embedding alternative
content: Prefer not to pull heavy models first; keyword hashing + tf weighting + cosine similarity is enough for prototype validation.

title: Failed attempt: naive theme aggregation
content: Simple keyword clustering mixed 'semantic time travel', 'timeline', and 'knowledge management' together—need better theme extraction heuristics.

title: Value of adding emotional dimension
content: If the timeline reflects emotional shifts, it may help recall motives and decision context.

title: Design timeline scoring heuristic
content: Assign each note semantic similarity, temporal span contrast, and continuity density scores; weight them to pick representative evolution points.

title: Need for incremental sync
content: Future Notion integration should periodically pull updates, distinguish creates vs edits, rebuild indexes while keeping stable reference ids.

title: Successful early concept recall test
content: Ran timeline_reconnect on mock data; resulting nodes matched my internal memory of idea evolution order.
